name: Bugio - #12
description:
Howler monkeys can be found in Brazil from southern Bahia to Rio Grande do Sul, always close to forest regions. Abroad it is seen in northern Argentina, in the Misiones region. Some studies indicate the presence of the group in Mexico and even in the cerrado region.
The howler monkey, also called howler and bearded monkey, is part of the group of monkeys of the genus Alouatta: arboreal, with herbivorous habits, strong body and long tail. Its most striking feature is the sound emitted by males that can be heard over long distances.
